tit.e: History of the Omi Komuro Domain

sen.j: 藩祖は小堀政一である。
sen.e: The original forefather of the domain was Masakazu KOBORI.
The original forefather of the domain was Masakazu KOBORI.
The original forefather of the domain was Masakazu KOBORI.

sen.j: 政一の父・小堀正次は浅井長政、豊臣秀吉に仕え、関ヶ原の戦いでは東軍に与して功を挙げたことから、戦後に備中松山藩を中心として1万4460石の所領を与えられた。
sen.e: Masakazu's father Masatsugu KOBORI, who served Nagamasa AZAI and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, was given a territory of 14,460 koku based on Bicchu Matsuyama Domain after the Battle of Sekigahara for taking sides with the East squad successfully in it.

Masakazu's father Masatsugu KOBORI, who served Nagamasa AZAI and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, was given a territory of 14,460 koku based on the Bitchu Matsuyama Domain after the Battle of Sekigahara for taking sides with the East squad successfully in it.
sen.cmt: Bicchu Matsuyama Domain→the Bitchu Matsuyama Domainに修正しました。
sen.e: Masakazu's father Masatsugu KOBORI, who served Nagamasa AZAI and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, was given a territory of 14,460 koku based on the Bitchu Matsuyama Domain after the Battle of Sekigahara for taking sides with the East squad successfully in it.

sen.j: 慶長9年（1604年）に正次が死去すると、子の政一が後を継いだ。
sen.e: When Masatsugu died in 1604, his son Masakazu replaced him.
When Masatsugu died in 1604, his son Masakazu replaced him.
When Masatsugu died in 1604, his son Masakazu replaced him.

sen.j: このとき、政一は2000石ほどを弟の小堀正行に分与している。
sen.e: At that time, Masakazu allocated about 2,000 koku to his younger brother Masayuki KOBORI.
At that time, Masakazu allocated about 2,000 koku to his younger brother Masayuki KOBORI.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)5年（1619年）、政一は備中松山より近江小室に移され、ここに近江小室藩が立藩した。
sen.e: In 1619, Masakazu was transferred from Bicchu Matsuyama to Omi Komuro, and there Omi Komuro Domain was founded.
In 1619, Masakazu was transferred from Bitchu Matsuyama to Omi Komuro, and there the Omi Komuro Domain was founded.
sen.cmt: Bicchu→Bitchuに修正、the Omi Komuro Domainとしました。
sen.e: In 1619, Masakazu was transferred from Bitchu Matsuyama to Omi Komuro, and there the Omi Komuro Domain was founded.

sen.j: ちなみに政一は小堀遠州の名で知られた優秀な芸術家である。
sen.e: For your information, Masakazu was an excellent artist known as Enshu KOBORI.

sen.j: 第2代藩主・小堀政之は弟に1000石を分与している。
sen.e: The 2nd lord of the domain, Masayuki KOBORI, allocated 1,000 koku to his younger brother.
The second lord of the domain, Masayuki KOBORI, allocated 1,000 koku to his younger brother.

sen.j: 第4代藩主・小堀政房も弟二人に500石、300石を分与したため、小堀氏は1万630石の大名となる。
sen.e: As the 4th lord of the domain, Masahusa KOBORI, also allocated 500 koku and 300 koku respectively to his two younger brothers, the KOBORI clan became the feudal lord of 10,630 koku.
As the fourth lord of the domain, Masahusa KOBORI, also allocated 500 koku and 300 koku respectively to his two younger brothers, the Kobori clan became the feudal lord of 10,630 koku.
sen.cmt: 4th→fourthとし、the KOBORI clan→the Kobori clanに修正しました。
sen.e: As the fourth lord of the domain, Masahusa KOBORI, also allocated 500 koku and 300 koku respectively to his two younger brothers, the Kobori clan became the feudal lord of 10,630 koku.

sen.j: 第5代藩主・小堀政峯は7年半にわたって若年寄を努めたことから、本来なら小堀氏は外様大名であったが、この功績により譜代大名の格式を許され、伺候席となった。
sen.e: For the 5th lord of the domain Masamine KOBORI's 7-and-a-half-year service as a position of Wakadoshiyori, the KOBORI clan, which was supposed to be a nonhereditary feudal lord, was admitted to amend the status into Fudai Daimyo (hereditary vassals to the Tokugawa Family) and was able to wait on a higher-ranked sheat to meet the Shogun.

For the fifth lord of the domain Masamine KOBORI's seven-and-a-half-year service as a position of Wakadoshiyori (junior councilor), the Kobori clan, which was supposed to be a nonhereditary feudal lord, was admitted to amend the status into Fudai Daimyo (hereditary vassals to the Tokugawa family) and was able to wait on a higher-ranked sheat to meet the Shogun.
sen.cmt: 5th→fifth、7-and-a-half-year→seven-and-a-half-yearとし、the KOBORI clan→the Kobori clanに修正、Familyの頭文字を小文字に変更、Wakadoshiyoriの補足を追加しました。(用語集参照)
sen.e: For the fifth lord of the domain Masamine KOBORI's seven-and-a-half-year service as a position of Wakadoshiyori (junior councilor), the Kobori clan, which was supposed to be a nonhereditary feudal lord, was admitted to amend the status into Fudai Daimyo (hereditary vassals to the Tokugawa family) and was able to wait on a higher-ranked sheat to meet the Shogun.

sen.j: しかし政峯の死後、後を継いだ第6代藩主の小堀政方は伏見奉行などを歴任し、さらに老中として権勢を振るった田沼意次に対して協力的な態度をとったため、田沼時代も末期の天明5年（1785年）に失脚した。
sen.e: However, Masamichi KOBORI, who succeeded to deceased Masamine as the 6th lord of the domain, had served in the posts including Fushimi bugyo, but was overthrown in 1785, the end of the Tanuma period, because he was cooperative with Okitsugu TANUMA who was influential as Roju (senior councilor).

sen.j: 翌年に意次が失脚すると、親田沼派の大名であったということから、田沼派の徹底的な粛清を図る松平定信によって天明8年（1788年)5月6日伏見奉行在職中、不正、服務規程違反などがあったために改易され、相模国小田原藩主大久保家にお預けの身となった。
sen.e: When Okitsugu was overthrown the following year, as he was a feudal lord of pro-Tamuna group, he was imposed sanctions for committing fraud and violating service regulations while in Fushimi bugyo on May 6, 1788, and left to the Okubo family, the lord of Odawara Domain, Sagami Province, by Sadanobu MATSUDAIRA who tied to purge the Tanuma group thoroughly.

sen.cmt: pro-Tamuna→pro-Tanumaに修正、旧暦→新暦に修正、the Odawara Domainとしました。
